item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
Phew. The sprint is over. Six days with my wife out of town, six days with the kids on my own. It's simultaneously a joy, a rush, and an exhaustion to have both of my kids by myself for a trip that long. I felt all of it hit me on early Saturday evening, when I was reaching for a beer to celebrate the kids going to sleep and decided it was simply time to sleep myself, instead. I tossed Hell House LLC: Lineage on my iPad (a regrettable decision, what an awful movie) and almost immediately zonked out. My wife being gone did not stop me from playing every single possible episode in Dispatch, though. I'm fully caught up for this week's finale.

-pk, who was legitimately sad when he realized he was caught up!

  • PODCAST: HOA – Crack open a cold one and light your designer charcoal, it's gonna be a beefy one! Special guest Emanuel Maiberg joins Rob to check back in on what has happened since his flooded home horror story. They discuss the emotional rollercoaster of finding a new house, HVACs and how to maintain them, and toss in a bit of home theater talk for good measure.
  • STREAM: Escape Simulator 2 – We had a blast playing R.E.P.O. last week, so it's time for Chia, Danika, Janet, and myself to try another co-op adventure.
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio – Fingers crossed for no migraines this week!
  • STREAM: Wheel of GeForce NOW – No, we will probably not decide to fail to play Europa Universalis V again, but boy I'm awfully tempted to lmao
  • BABY STEPS?: We have not forgotten about this game. We'll get back to it eventually, promise. Just wanted to let folks know that it's still on my brain, and I have so far resisted the impulse to try making progress in my spare time.

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
